text: Marius Barnard (3 November 1927 - 14 November 2014) was a South African cardiac surgeon. He was the inventor of critical illness insurance. Barnard was a member of the South African parliament between 1980 and 1989. Barnard was born in Beaufort West, Western Cape. His brother was Christiaan Barnard. Barnard died in Johannesburg, aged 87. ==References== Category:1927 births Category:2014 deaths Category:Afrikaner people Category:South African MPs Category:Surgeons
